name: Dulce Vida

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a four-day stay in Casita 4. Wow! Incredibly spacious, beautiful furnishings throughout (two bedrooms, and an extra small sleeping area; large living room, dining room, and kitchen; two well-functioning bathrooms), windows and doors aplenty opening out onto gorgeous gardens, and an enormous terrace area overlooking the pool with views down to the ocean. I think two other apartments were occupied while we were there, but it seems you always feel you have the place to yourself. And it's perfect walking distance from everything in town -- a few blocks from the Malecon (be warned, though -- they're steep uphill on the way home...), from Barcelona Tapas and Cafe des Artistes, River Cafe, Vitea, Trio, and a lovely walk to the Zona Romantica. John Huston's former house is right next door -- and the gardener started out working for Richard Burton! My only caveats are that it's incredibly hot in summer, despite an excellent fan system, and the geckos which keep you insect-free are very noisy at night, so bring ear-plugs. Other than that: Dulce Vida is stunning. Look no further.
reviews.title: Most beautiful place I've ever stayed

reviews.text: PS The website really doesn't do the place justice; look at traveler photos instead.
reviews.title: Much more than what I expected

reviews.text: I stayed at Casa Dulce Vida for four days... regretfully!! I could have stayed there for a couple of weeks and still need some more!
reviews.title: Casa Dulce Vida a Hidden Gem in the Heart of Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Casa 4 which is beautiful and big, it was so much more than what I expected. All houses seem to be very nice and the pool (with its red tiles) is beautiful. The sights from the "casas" are great and we simply loved the place.
reviews.title: This is THE place to say in PV

reviews.text: It's well kept and all staff is very nice. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: An oasis in the heart of historic Old Town in Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 7 days in Casa 2. The casa was roomy, clean, and very comfortable. It was next to the pool, and it felt like we had the pool all to ourselves. Audrey, Chawnalee, Lee and their staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely return sometime, and we highly recommend it!
reviews.title: wonderful get-a-way accomodations

likes.liked: — location, small size, staff, privacy, informality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were travelling to Nuevo Vallarta for a company function and wanted to come early to get a more authentic PV feel before being banished to "AI" Land.
reviews.title: Casa Incredible!!!!

likes.disliked: — That I was only staying there 1 day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor I contacted Casa Dulce Vida directly to check for availability and b/c it's the slow season (our stay was 5/16) we were able to get a room. And what a "room" it was. Great Views, access to the beautiful pool and gardens, and great location in the city.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Get-Away!!!

likes.liked: — You fell like you're in your own house

reviews.title: What a Great Place!
reviews.text: My wife and I had GREAT stay and would definitely put this at the top of our list for future visits to PV. WAY better than any AI out in Nuevo Vallarta.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Dulce Vida during memorial day weekend in May 2007 for 2 nights. After reading all the reviews on TA, we decided to take a chance and stay here for 2 nights and the Westin by the Marina for 1 night (read review for Westin) I LOVE the dulce vida. Only 1 other couple was there during our stay. We stayed in Casa 5. Our Casa was sooo big! We loved having breakfast in the morning on our private patio area with a gorgeous view of the ocean. Fireworks at 9pm every night. Easy walk to the Malecon. Yes, the walk is a bit harder going back to the Casa but still a nice walk (10 min max). We explored the neighborhood and took photos with the local ladies/children. We took advantage of restaurant week (from mid May to end of May every year) and had delicious prix-fixe dinners for $25.00 pp. We had dinner the first night at LA PALAPA. Romantic restaurant on the beach. 30 minutes walk along the beach from Dulce. Dinner the next night at Cafe Des Artistes. Very artsy. Great food and atmosphere. It's only a 5 minute walk from Dulce. We walked around the downtown area during the day and relaxed by the pool (very pretty red tiles in person) It is a bit hot a night. Just leave the fan on and open the windows and doors. Very safe. There are also a lot of clubs and bars near by for those of you who want to party. Very convenient! We will be back again in a few weeks with friends. Can't wait!!!!!!
reviews.title: Living Sweetly in PV

likes.liked: — Beautiful, authentic and charming old-style accomodations that are clean, bright and spacious
likes.disliked: — The hill and the noise from the discos a mile away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at this beautiful villa in the center of older Puerto Vallarta. Located about 4 blocks up from the Malecon, Dulce Vida is a quiet, peaceful retreat in the midst of a bustling tourist community. Our hosts, Audrey, Lee and Chawnalee Wark are always extremely helpful, suggesting excellent restaurants and exciting area excursions.
reviews.title: Away from the crowds

likes.disliked: — Walking up the hill on a hot day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The villa has 6 apartments available, all with kitchens, varying in size up to the mammoth 2700 sq ft Casa 4. We have stayed in Casa 6 and Casa 7 previously. Check out their website to see descriptions and photos of the various "casas". Across the street is a small store selling a few basics such as eggs, bread and juice for breakfasts. Much larger markets are a short bus ride away (5 pesos or about 50 cents). Its great fun to take the buses around the area. Taxis in the center of town cost 30 or 40 pesos, about $3 or $4, and are virtually everywhere. Confirm the price before getting into the taxi.
reviews.title: Life & Prices are Sweet at Casa Dulce Vida

likes.liked: — The space, the location, the perks (water, kitchen, books, advice on where to go), the wildlife out back
likes.disliked: — The room my parents were in, there is no live-in service attendant so on odd hours requests are hard to make

reviews.text: In addition to the charming "casas", there is a nice pool area and a lovely small garden with nice seating. The view from the pool/garden level and the large roof-top veranda is spectacular. The Bay of Banderas is stunning as the sun sets across it, and delightful in morning as the cruise ships head for the distant marina. We continue to be so thankful to be able to relax and enjoy Puerto Vallarta from such a convenient and pleasant location.
reviews.title: Awesome Location in PV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I give Casa Dulce Vida 5 "bubbles," but with a caveat - this is suite dependent. Not all rooms are created equal.
reviews.title: Great Location and a Wonderful City

likes.liked: — The location to Old Town. It was only two blocks away from the main broadwalk called the Malecon.
likes.disliked: — The cleanliness of the small showers in Casa 6 and 7.

reviews.title: Only suckers stay at resorts in Mexico
reviews.text: Here are details on the location, the suite we stayed in, and the reason I say all rooms are not equal.

As other reviewers have observed, how much you like Casa Dulce Vida may depend on which casa you're in. I stayed in casa 5, which was lovely: a very spacious one-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment (with two extra twin beds in the living room) with a private patio overlooking the ocean. Casa Dulce Vida has a good location in the center of Puerto Vallarta, close to many restaurants and the ocean. Nice pool area, friendly owners. I also liked the fact that it was located in an ordinary residential neighborhood (rather than a tourist ghetto). All in all, a real bargain at $125 per night. My only small complaint is that the wireless internet did not reach my room, and so I brought my laptop down to a common area when I wanted to go online. While casa 7 probably has good reception, I'd think that that room gets a fair amount of street noise.
reviews.title: Great value at Casa Dulce Vida

likes.liked: — The private patio with the view of the ocean.

reviews.text: My wife and I booked casa #2 for 21 nights. We were warmly greeted by Audrey and Lee, the cold beer offered upon arrival was a very nice touch. The hosts are masters at arranging pretty much anything your heart desires - tours, pedi and manicures, they even have a fabulous masseuse on call. My wife had a massage each of the 3 weeks we were there and she says they were the best massages she has ever had.
reviews.title: Would I stay there again - probably not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You may choose to have as much or as little interaction with staff and other guests as you wish. We were there to get completely away and disconnect and this is were Casa Dulce Vida shines. You are literally in your own, quiet, secluded world. No tv's - radios or other distractions. The dusty - gritty old part of PV is just on the other side of the gate and a world away.
reviews.title: Wonderful place - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You'll be serenaded by a blind rooster most of the night and you'll wonder what-in-the-world is clanking down the cobblestone hill at 2 in the morning, but it all grows on you.
reviews.title: Friendly people and good value

likes.liked: — lots of space, cleanliness and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — walking up the hill and street noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What will never grow on us though, and this is really too bad for the Casa because it does have its charm, is being awakened in the middle of the night by cockroaches. We had lots and lots of cockroaches. So bad, in fact that we spent 2 nights in another hotel. The staff was sorry for the inconvenience and they sprayed Raid for 3 days and called in a Professional as well, but we simply could not sleep in the bedroom, ever again. They did move our bed to the dining room and that's where we slept for the last week of our stay. Audrey did treat my wife to a free massage, which I was grateful for, but I feel that more should have been offered for the 2 nights of lost sleep and the 2 nights that we had to move to another hotel to let the Raid do its job.
reviews.title: Stay here only if you like beautiful places, nice people, and no crowds

description: This beautiful large property has great views and is centrally located to Pv's best restaurants and shopping. Enjoy many of the casas as a group or select one individually. Enjoy the many gardens, patios and entrances that provide privacy. Large pool. Maid service, on site massages and beauty services. Don't just visit ... Live it!
